Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/SkyLabubu.sol":"SkyLabubu"},"evmVersion":"paris","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs","useLiteralContent":true},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlUpgradeable.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n// OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.4.0) (access/AccessControl.sol)\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport {IAccessControl} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/IAccessControl.sol\";\nimport {ContextUpgradeable} from \"../utils/ContextUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport {IERC165} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol\";\nimport {ERC165Upgradeable} from \"../utils/introspection/ERC165Upgradeable.sol\";\nimport {Initializable} from \"../proxy/utils/Initializable.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Contract module that allows children to implement role-based access\n * control mechanisms. This is a lightweight version that doesn't allow enumerating role\n * members except through off-chain means by accessing the contract event logs. Some\n * applications may benefit from on-chain enumerability, for those cases see\n * {AccessControlEnumerable}.\n *\n * Roles are referred to by their `bytes32` identifier. These should be exposed\n * in the external API and be unique. The best way to achieve this is by\n * using `public constant` hash digests:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * bytes32 public constant MY_ROLE = keccak256(\"MY_ROLE\");\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be used to represent a set of permissions. To restrict access to a\n * function call, use {hasRole}:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * function foo() public {\n *     require(hasRole(MY_ROLE, msg.sender));\n *     ...\n * }\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be granted and revoked dynamically via the {grantRole} and\n * {revokeRole} functions. Each role has an associated admin role, and only\n * accounts that have a role's admin role can call {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.\n *\n * By default, the admin role for all roles is `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`, which means\n * that only accounts with this role will be able to grant or revoke other\n * roles. \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol\";\nimport {ERC20Upgradeable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/ERC20Upgradeable.sol\";\nimport {IERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\nimport {Math} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol\";\nimport {UUPSUpgradeable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport {AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/extensions/AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable.sol\";\n//import \"hardhat/console.sol\";\n\ncontract SkyLabubu is ERC20Upgradeable, UUPSUpgradeable, AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable, LabubuConst {\n    using SafeMath for uint256;\n    bytes32 internal constant FOUNDATION = keccak256(\"FOUNDATION\");\n    bytes32 internal constant UPGRADE = keccak256(\"UPGRADE\");\n    // keccak-256 hash of \"eip1967.proxy.implementation\" subtracted by 1.\n    bytes32 internal constant IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT = 0x360894a13ba1a3210667c828492db98dca3e2076cc3735a920a3ca505d382bbc;\n\n    uint256 public maxAmount;\n\n    ILabubuNFT public nft;\n    ILabubuRecoupment public recoupment;\n    ILabubuOracle public oracle;\n    IRegisterV2 public registerV2;\n\n    address public deflationAddress; // \u6bcf\u65e51%\u9500\u6bc1\u5730\u5740\n    address public sellFeeAddress; // \u5356\u51fa\u624b\u7eed\u8d39\u5730\u5740\n    address public depositFeeAddress; // 10%\u5165\u91d1\u624b\u7eed\u8d39\n\n    address public pancakePair;\n\n    mapping(address => uint256) public accountSales;\n    mapping(address => uint256) public addLiquidityUnlockTime;\n    mapping(address => uint256) public accountLpAmount;\n\n    uint16[] public removeLpBurnRate;\n    uint16[3] public dailyBurnRate;\n    mapping(uint => bool) public dailyBurned; // \u6307\u5b9a\u5929\u6570\u662f\u5426\u9500\u6bc1\n\n    bool public burnAndMintSwitch;\n    bool public removeLpSwitch;\n\n    event Deposit(address indexed from, uint usdtValue, uint bnbValue);\n    event WithdrawalToken(address indexed token, address indexed receiver, uint indexed amount);\n    event TriggerDailyBurnAndMint(uint256 indexed liquidityPairBalance, uint256 indexed burnAmount, uint256 indexed holdLPAwardAmount);\n    event LpRedeemed(address indexed user, uint labubuPrice, uint backAmount, uint burnAmount);\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor(address _wBNB, address _router) {\n        _disableInitializers();\n\n        bnbTokenAddress = _wBNB;\n        pancakeV2Router = _router;\n    }\n\n    function initialize(\n        address _minter,\n        address _sellFeeAddress,\n        address _deflationAddress,\n        address _depositFeeAddress,\n        ILabubuNFT _nft,\n        IRegisterV2 _registerV2\n    ) public initializer {\n        // bnbTokenAddress \u5fc5\u987b\u662ftoken0\n        require(address(this) > bnbTokenAddress, '!gt');\n\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init();\n        __AccessControlEnumerable_init();\n        __ERC20_init(\"Sky Labubu\", \"SkyLabubu\");\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, _msgSender());\n        _grantRole(UPGRADE, _msgSender());\n        _grantRole(FOUNDATION, _msgSender());\n\n        nft = _nft;\n\n        sellFeeAddress = _sellFeeAddress;\n        deflationAddress = _deflationAddress;\n        depositFeeAddress = _depositFeeAddress;\n        registerV2 = _registerV2;\n\n        pancakePair = IPancakeFactory(\n            IPancakeRouter02(pancakeV2Router).factory()\n        ).createPair(address(this), bnbTokenAddress);\n\n        _approve(address(this), pancakeV2Router, ~uint256(0));\n        IERC20(bnbTokenAddress).approve(pancakeV2Router, ~uint256(0));\n\n        removeLpBurnRate.push(9000);\n        removeLpBurnRate.push(7000);\n        removeLpBurnRate.push(5000);\n        removeLpBurnRate.push(3000);\n\n        maxAmount = 0.1 ether;\n\n        // 0\u9500\u6bc1\u30011\u9879\u76ee\u65b9\u30012\u5206\u7ea2\n        dailyBurnRate = [100, 0, 100];\n\n        // \u521d\u59cb\u4f9b\u5e94\u91cf\n        _mint(_minter, 210000000000 * 10 ** decimals());\n    }\n\n    receive() external payable {\n        deposit();\n    }\n\n    function deposit() public payable returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 value = msg.value;\n\n        // \u65e9\u671f\u5165\u91d1\u9650\u5236\n        nft.canDeposit(msg.sender, value);\n\n        if (value == 0.6 ether) {\n            nft.safeMint{value: value}(msg.sender);\n            return 0;\n        }\n\n        // 1e17 \u539f\u7248\u9650\u5236isContract(msg.sender)\n        if (value < MIN_AMOUNT || value > maxAmount || value % 0.1 ether > 0) {\n            revert(\"!value\");\n        }\n\n        require(registerV2.registered(msg.sender), \"!registered\");\n\n        accountSales[msg.sender] += value;\n        require(accountSales[msg.sender] <= maxAmount, \"maxAmount\");\n\n        addLiquidityUnlockTime[msg.sender] = block.timestamp;\n\n        // 20%\u5e02\u573a\uff0c10%NFT\uff0c10%\u9879\u76ee\u65b9\n        _distributeBNB(msg.sender, value);\n\n        uint256 marketIncentives = value.mul(MARKET_INCENTIVES).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        uint256 _value = value.sub(marketIncentives).div(2);\n\n        uint256 tokenAmt;\n        tokenAmt = ethToTokenSwap(address(this), _value, address(this));\n        IWETH(bnbTokenAddress).deposit{value: _value}();\n\n        uint liquidity = addLiquidityEth(_value, tokenAmt, msg.sender);\n\n        emit Deposit(msg.sender, getUsdtValue(value), value);\n        return liquidity;\n    }\n\n    function _update(address from, address to, uint256 amount) internal override {\n        require(!isBlacklisted(from), \"!blacklisted\");\n\n        if (amount == 1 ether && !registerV2.registered(from)) {\n            registerV2.register(from, to);\n        }\n\n        if (isTaxExempt(from) || isTaxExempt(to)) {\n            super._update(from, to, amount);\n            return;\n        }\n\n        TransferType tType = getTransferType(from, to);\n        require(tType != TransferType.Buy, \"!buy\");\n        require(tType != TransferType.AddLiquidity, \"!add\");\n        if (!removeLpSwitch)\n            require(tType != TransferType.RemoveLiquidity, \"!Remove\");\n\n        if (tType == TransferType.RemoveLiquidity) {\n            // \u8ba1\u7b97lp\u6570\u91cf\n            uint lpAmount = calLiquidityByLububu(amount);\n            require(accountLpAmount[to] >= lpAmount, \"!added lp amount\");\n            accountLpAmount[to] -= lpAmount;\n            recoupment.setPayee(to, accountLpAmount[to]);\n\n            // \u8bb0\u5f55\u6dfb\u52a0\u7684lpAmount\n            uint256 _addLiquidityUnlockTime = addLiquidityUnlockTime[to];\n\n            uint256 _amount;\n            if (block.timestamp < _addLiquidityUnlockTime + 30 days) {\n                _amount = amount.mul(removeLpBurnRate[0]).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n            } else if (block.timestamp < _addLiquidityUnlockTime + 60 days) {\n                _amount = amount.mul(removeLpBurnRate[1]).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n            } else if (block.timestamp < _addLiquidityUnlockTime + 90 days) {\n                _amount = amount.mul(removeLpBurnRate[2]).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n            } else {\n                _amount = amount.mul(removeLpBurnRate[3]).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n            }\n            super._update(from, BLACK_ADDRESS, _amount);\n            amount = amount.sub(_amount);\n            super._update(from, to, amount);\n\n            emit LpRedeemed(to, oracle.getLabubuPrice(), amount, _amount);\n        } else if (tType == TransferType.Sell) {\n            swapSellAward(from, amount);\n        } else {\n            super._update(from, to, amount);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function safeTransferETH(address to, uint value) internal {\n        (bool success,) = to.call{value: value}(new bytes(0));\n        require(success, 'ETH_TRANSFER_FAILED');\n    }\n\n    enum TransferType {\n        AddLiquidity,\n        RemoveLiquidity,\n        Sell,\n        Buy,\n        Transfer\n    }\n\n    function getTransferType(address from, address to) public view returns (TransferType) {\n        if (to == SELL_MIDDLEWARE) {\n            return TransferType.Sell;\n        } else if (to == pancakePair) {\n            return TransferType.AddLiquidity;\n        } else if (from == pancakePair) {\n            uint256 balanceBnb = IERC20(bnbTokenAddress).balanceOf(pancakePair);\n            (uint256 rBnb,,) = IPancakePair(pancakePair).getReserves();\n            if (balanceBnb < rBnb) return TransferType.RemoveLiquidity;\n            else return TransferType.Buy;\n        } else {\n            return TransferType.Transfer;\n        }\n    }\n\n    function isTaxExempt(address account) public view returns (bool) {\n        return hasRole(keccak256(\"TaxExempt\"), account);\n    }\n\n    function isBlacklisted(address account) public view returns (bool) {\n        return hasRole(keccak256(\"Blacklist\"), account);\n    }\n\n    function getUsdtValue(uint bnbAmount) internal view returns (uint) {\n        return oracle.getBnbPrice() * bnbAmount / 1e12;\n    }\n\n    function ethToTokenSwap(address toToken, uint256 amount, address recipient) internal returns (uint256) {\n        require(msg.value > 0, \"Send ETH to swap\");\n\n        address[] memory path = new address[](2);\n        path[0] = bnbTokenAddress;\n        path[1] = toToken;\n\n        IPancakeRouter02(pancakeV2Router).swapExactETHForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens{value: amount}(\n            0,\n            path,\n            BUY_MIDDLEWARE,\n            block.timestamp\n        );\n        uint256 balance = IERC20(toToken).balanceOf(BUY_MIDDLEWARE);\n\n        super._update(BUY_MIDDLEWARE, recipient, balance);\n\n        return balance;\n    }\n\n    function addLiquidityEth(uint256 tokenAmtA, uint256 tokenAmtB, address recipient) internal returns (uint256) {\n        require(tokenAmtA > 0, \"Insufficient tokenA balance\");\n        require(tokenAmtB > 0, \"Insufficient tokenB balance\");\n\n        (,,uint liquidity) = IPancakeRouter02(pancakeV2Router).addLiquidity(\n            address(bnbTokenAddress),\n            address(this),\n            tokenAmtA,\n            tokenAmtB,\n            0,\n            0,\n            recipient,\n            block.timestamp + 600\n        );\n        accountLpAmount[recipient] += liquidity;\n\n        // \u8bbe\u7f6e\u6743\u91cd\n        recoupment.setPayee(recipient, accountLpAmount[recipient]);\n\n        return liquidity;\n    }\n\n    function calLiquidityByLububu(uint256 lububuAmount) public view returns (uint) {\n        uint totalLp = IPancakePair(pancakePair).totalSupply();\n        (,uint rThis,) = IPancakePair(pancakePair).getReserves();\n        return lububuAmount * totalLp / rThis;\n    }\n\n    function tokenToEthSwap(uint256 amountIn, address recipient) internal {\n        require(amountIn > 0, \"Invalid input amount\");\n\n        address[] memory path = new address[](2);\n        path[0] = address(this);\n        path[1] = bnbTokenAddress;\n\n        IPancakeRouter02(pancakeV2Router).swapExactTokensForETHSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens(\n            amountIn,\n            0,\n            path,\n            recipient,\n            block.timestamp + 600\n        );\n    }\n\n    function swapSellAward(address from, uint256 amount) internal {\n        // \u8dcc\u51e0\u4e2a\u70b9\uff0c\u624b\u7eed\u8d39x2\u3002\u6700\u4f4e5%\n        uint rate = oracle.getDecline() * 2;\n        if (rate < 500) rate = 500;\n        if (rate >= 10000) rate = 10000;\n        // \u624b\u7eed\u8d39\n        uint256 sellFeeAmount = amount.mul(rate).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        // tokenToEthSwap(sellFeeAmount, sellFeeAddress);\n        super._update(from, sellFeeAddress, sellFeeAmount);\n        // \u5356\u51fa\n        uint256 leftAmount = amount.sub(sellFeeAmount);\n        if (leftAmount > 0) {\n            super._update(from, address(this), leftAmount);\n            tokenToEthSwap(leftAmount, from);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _distributeBNB(address user, uint256 _totalAmount) internal {\n        require(\n            address(nft) != address(0) &&\n            depositFeeAddress != address(0) &&\n            address(recoupment) != address(0), \"!0\"\n        );\n        // \u63a8\u8350\u5173\u7cfb 20%\n        // !!!\u8fd9\u91cc\u768420%\u4e0d\u80fd\u968f\u610f\u4fee\u6539\uff0crecoupment\u5408\u7ea6value * 5\uff0c\u8ba1\u7b97\u6295\u5165\n        uint256 referralValue = _totalAmount.mul(2000).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        recoupment.distributeReferralReward{value: referralValue}(user);\n\n        // NFT 10%\n        uint256 nftValue = _totalAmount.mul(1000).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        nft.sendReward{value: nftValue}();\n\n        // \u9879\u76ee\u65b9 10%\n        uint256 depositFeeAmount = _totalAmount.mul(1000).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        safeTransferETH(depositFeeAddress, depositFeeAmount);\n    }\n\n    function triggerDailyBurnAndMint() external {\n        if (!burnAndMintSwitch) return;\n\n        uint256 timeKey = (block.timestamp / 86400) * 86400;\n        if (dailyBurned[timeKey]) return;\n        dailyBurned[timeKey] = true;\n\n        uint256 liquidityPairBalance = this.balanceOf(pancakePair);\n        if (liquidityPairBalance == 0) return;\n\n        uint256 blackAmount = liquidityPairBalance.mul(dailyBurnRate[0]).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        if (blackAmount > 0) {\n            super._update(pancakePair, BLACK_ADDRESS, blackAmount);\n        }\n\n        uint256 holdLPAwardAmount = liquidityPairBalance.mul(dailyBurnRate[1]).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        if (holdLPAwardAmount > 0) {\n            super._update(pancakePair, deflationAddress, holdLPAwardAmount);\n        }\n\n        uint256 recoupmentAmount = liquidityPairBalance.mul(dailyBurnRate[2]).div(BASE_PERCENT);\n        if (recoupmentAmount > 0) {\n            super._update(pancakePair, address(this), recoupmentAmount);\n            recoupment.sendReward(recoupmentAmount);\n        }\n\n        emit TriggerDailyBurnAndMint(liquidityPairBalance, blackAmount, holdLPAwardAmount);\n\n        // \u6700\u540e\u540c\u6b65\u4e00\u6b21 Pair \u72b6\u6001\n        IPancakePair(pancakePair).sync();\n    }\n\n    function setBurnAndMintSwitch(bool _switch) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        burnAndMintSwitch = _switch;\n    }\n\n    function setRemoveLpSwitch(bool _switch) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        removeLpSwitch = _switch;\n    }\n\n    function setMintNFTAddress(ILabubuNFT _nft) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        nft = _nft;\n    }\n\n    function setDeflationAddress(address _deflationAddress) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        deflationAddress = _deflationAddress;\n    }\n\n    function setMaxAmount(uint256 amount) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        maxAmount = amount;\n    }\n\n    function setOracle(ILabubuOracle _oracle) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        oracle = _oracle;\n    }\n\n    function setRecoupment(ILabubuRecoupment _recoupment) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        _approve(address(this), address(_recoupment), ~uint256(0));\n\n        recoupment = _recoupment;\n    }\n\n    function withdrawEth(address recipient, uint256 value) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        require(address(this).balance >= value, \"Insufficient BNB\");\n        safeTransferETH(recipient, value);\n\n        emit WithdrawalToken(address(0x0), recipient, value);\n    }\n\n    function withdrawalToken(address token, address receiver, uint amount) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        IERC20(token).transfer(receiver, amount);\n        emit WithdrawalToken(token, receiver, amount);\n    }\n\n    function setRemoveLpBurnRate(uint16[] calldata _burn) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        delete removeLpBurnRate; // \u6e05\u7a7a\u65e7\u6570\u636e\n        for (uint i = 0; i < _burn.length; i++) {\n            removeLpBurnRate.push(_burn[i]);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function setDailBurnRate(uint16[3] calldata _burn) external onlyRole(FOUNDATION) {\n        require(_burn[0] + _burn[1] + _burn[2] == 200, \"!200\");\n\n        dailyBurnRate = _burn;\n    }\n\n    function testView() public pure returns (uint) {\n        return 3;\n    }\n\n    function upgradeTo(address newImplementation) external {\n        upgradeToAndCall(newImplementation, \"\");\n    }\n\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(address newImplementation) internal view override onlyRole(UPGRADE) {\n        require(\n            keccak256(Address.functionStaticCall(newImplementation, abi.encodeWithSignature('proxiableUUID()'))) ==\n            keccak256(abi.encodePacked(IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT)),\n            \"!UUID\"\n        );\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x9911cb613a808659ecc84e229daa93cc844569af5eced326644567b3fc2a12df","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/ILabubuNFT.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.13;\n\ninterface ILabubuNFT {\n    function safeMint(address to) external payable returns (uint256);\n    function sendReward() external payable;\n    function canDeposit(address account, uint value) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0xa21a5c50fa55313e10b8e03ce61448adb4ca949f8663416c4d14d103e0cc8433","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/ILabubuOracle.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.13;\n\ninterface ILabubuOracle {\n    function setOpenPrice() external;\n    function getDecline() external view returns (uint);\n    function getBnbPrice() external view returns (uint price);\n    function getLabubuPrice() external view returns (uint price);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x21d226e78f352d108a9a0a4c50de8644eae09e742396d1b691453182d6498aca","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/ILabubuRecoupment.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.13;\n\ninterface ILabubuRecoupment {\n    function distributeReferralReward(address account) external payable;\n    function sendReward(uint amount) external;\n    function setPayee(address account, uint shares) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x4c3fc58fea8dff49d59031a853670205bccad4b3f03d5cded49d15144f587450","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IManager.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.13;\n\ninterface IManager {\n    function allowWithdraw() external view;\n\n    function allowUpgrade(address newImplementation, address sender) external view;\n\n    function allowFoundation(address sender) external view;\n\n    function allowParam(address sender) external view;\n\n    function allowMint(address sender) external view;\n\n    function allowBitMiner(address sender) external view;\n\n    function paused() external view returns (bool);\n\n    function hasFreeRole(address sender) external view returns (bool);\n\n    function hasRole(bytes32 role, address account) external view returns (bool);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xaa07a7927be9ef58ab8e310db798daf5567c58c8da09e39631c94f0446ea4056","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IPancake.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\r\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\r\n\r\ninterface IPancakeRouter01 {\r\n    function factory() external pure returns (address);\r\n    function WETH() external pure returns (address);\r\n\r\n    function addLiquidity(\r\n        address tokenA,\r\n        address tokenB,\r\n        uint amountADesired,\r\n        uint amountBDesired,\r\n        uint amountAMin,\r\n        uint amountBMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external returns (uint amountA, uint amountB, uint liquidity);\r\n    function addLiquidityETH(\r\n        address token,\r\n        uint amountTokenDesired,\r\n        uint amountTokenMin,\r\n        uint amountETHMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external payable returns (uint amountToken, uint amountETH, uint liquidity);\r\n    function removeLiquidity(\r\n        address tokenA,\r\n        address tokenB,\r\n        uint liquidity,\r\n        uint amountAMin,\r\n        uint amountBMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external returns (uint amountA, uint amountB);\r\n    function removeLiquidityETH(\r\n        address token,\r\n        uint liquidity,\r\n        uint amountTokenMin,\r\n        uint amountETHMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external returns (uint amountToken, uint amountETH);\r\n    function removeLiquidityWithPermit(\r\n        address tokenA,\r\n        address tokenB,\r\n        uint liquidity,\r\n        uint amountAMin,\r\n        uint amountBMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline,\r\n        bool approveMax, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s\r\n    ) external returns (uint amountA, uint amountB);\r\n    function removeLiquidityETHWithPermit(\r\n        address token,\r\n        uint liquidity,\r\n        uint amountTokenMin,\r\n        uint amountETHMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline,\r\n        bool approveMax, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s\r\n    ) external returns (uint amountToken, uint amountETH);\r\n    function swapExactTokensForTokens(\r\n        uint amountIn,\r\n        uint amountOutMin,\r\n        address[] calldata path,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n    function swapTokensForExactTokens(\r\n        uint amountOut,\r\n        uint amountInMax,\r\n        address[] calldata path,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n    function swapExactETHForTokens(uint amountOutMin, address[] calldata path, address to, uint deadline)\r\n        external\r\n        payable\r\n        returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n    function swapTokensForExactETH(uint amountOut, uint amountInMax, address[] calldata path, address to, uint deadline)\r\n        external\r\n        returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n    function swapExactTokensForETH(uint amountIn, uint amountOutMin, address[] calldata path, address to, uint deadline)\r\n        external\r\n        returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n    function swapETHForExactTokens(uint amountOut, address[] calldata path, address to, uint deadline)\r\n        external\r\n        payable\r\n        returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n\r\n    function quote(uint amountA, uint reserveA, uint reserveB) external pure returns (uint amountB);\r\n    function getAmountOut(uint amountIn, uint reserveIn, uint reserveOut) external pure returns (uint amountOut);\r\n    function getAmountIn(uint amountOut, uint reserveIn, uint reserveOut) external pure returns (uint amountIn);\r\n    function getAmountsOut(uint amountIn, address[] calldata path) external view returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n    function getAmountsIn(uint amountOut, address[] calldata path) external view returns (uint[] memory amounts);\r\n}\r\n\r\ninterface IPancakeRouter02 is IPancakeRouter01 {\r\n    function removeLiquidityETHSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens(\r\n        address token,\r\n        uint liquidity,\r\n        uint amountTokenMin,\r\n        uint amountETHMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external returns (uint amountETH);\r\n    function removeLiquidityETHWithPermitSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens(\r\n        address token,\r\n        uint liquidity,\r\n        uint amountTokenMin,\r\n        uint amountETHMin,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline,\r\n        bool approveMax, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s\r\n    ) external returns (uint amountETH);\r\n\r\n    function swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens(\r\n        uint amountIn,\r\n        uint amountOutMin,\r\n        address[] calldata path,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external;\r\n    function swapExactETHForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens(\r\n        uint amountOutMin,\r\n        address[] calldata path,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external payable;\r\n    function swapExactTokensForETHSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens(\r\n        uint amountIn,\r\n        uint amountOutMin,\r\n        address[] calldata path,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint deadline\r\n    ) external;\r\n}\r\n\r\ninterface IPancakeFactory {\r\n    event PairCreated(address indexed token0, address indexed token1, address pair, uint);\r\n\r\n    function feeTo() external view returns (address);\r\n    function feeToSetter() external view returns (address);\r\n\r\n    function getPair(address tokenA, address tokenB) external view returns (address pair);\r\n    function allPairs(uint) external view returns (address pair);\r\n    function allPairsLength() external view returns (uint);\r\n\r\n    function createPair(address tokenA, address tokenB) external returns (address pair);\r\n\r\n    function setFeeTo(address) external;\r\n    function setFeeToSetter(address) external;\r\n\r\n    function INIT_CODE_PAIR_HASH() external view returns (bytes32);\r\n}\r\n\r\ninterface IPancakePair {\r\n    event Approval(address indexed owner, address indexed spender, uint value);\r\n    event Transfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint value);\r\n\r\n    function name() external pure returns (string memory);\r\n    function symbol() external pure returns (string memory);\r\n    function decimals() external pure returns (uint8);\r\n    function totalSupply() external view returns (uint);\r\n    function balanceOf(address owner) external view returns (uint);\r\n    function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view returns (uint);\r\n\r\n    function approve(address spender, uint value) external returns (bool);\r\n    function transfer(address to, uint value) external returns (bool);\r\n    function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint value) external returns (bool);\r\n\r\n    function DOMAIN_SEPARATOR() external view returns (bytes32);\r\n    function PERMIT_TYPEHASH() external pure returns (bytes32);\r\n    function nonces(address owner) external view returns (uint);\r\n\r\n    function permit(address owner, address spender, uint value, uint deadline, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s) external;\r\n\r\n    event Mint(address indexed sender, uint amount0, uint amount1);\r\n    event Burn(address indexed sender, uint amount0, uint amount1, address indexed to);\r\n    event Swap(\r\n        address indexed sender,\r\n        uint amount0In,\r\n        uint amount1In,\r\n        uint amount0Out,\r\n        uint amount1Out,\r\n        address indexed to\r\n    );\r\n    event Sync(uint112 reserve0, uint112 reserve1);\r\n\r\n    function MINIMUM_LIQUIDITY() external pure returns (uint);\r\n    function factory() external view returns (address);\r\n    function token0() external view returns (address);\r\n    function token1() external view returns (address);\r\n    function getReserves() external view returns (uint112 reserve0, uint112 reserve1, uint32 blockTimestampLast);\r\n    function price0CumulativeLast() external view returns (uint);\r\n    function price1CumulativeLast() external view returns (uint);\r\n    function kLast() external view returns (uint);\r\n\r\n    function mint(address to) external returns (uint liquidity);\r\n    function burn(address to) external returns (uint amount0, uint amount1);\r\n    function swap(uint amount0Out, uint amount1Out, address to, bytes calldata data) external;\r\n    function skim(address to) external;\r\n    function sync() external;\r\n\r\n    function initialize(address, address) external;\r\n}","keccak256":"0xbb85aa3bd521f87e0e923fbd091449e5e3da669372e9b86401de1e674a019067","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IRegisterV2.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.13;\n\ninterface IRegisterV2 {\n    function getReferrers(address user, uint count) external view returns (address[] memory _referrers, uint realCount);\n    function registered(address user) external view returns (bool);\n    function referrers(address) external view returns (address);\n    function getReferrals(address user) external view returns (address[] memory);\n    function register(address referral, address referrer) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x0ce929fdfbe078f325d1c655f275a863051b2d2023d81ad3f7038017a29b5eea","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IWETH.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.13;\n\ninterface IWETH {\n    function deposit() external payable;\n\n    function withdraw(uint256 amount) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0xe08cdb980e0d4382650344163e2fd8490183ec8ee430bd782a196e6545c41c79","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lib/LabubuConst.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\ncontract LabubuConst {\n    // \u63a8\u8350\u5956\u52b1\n    uint256 public constant MARKET_INCENTIVES = 4000;\n    uint256 public constant BASE_PERCENT = 10000;\n    uint256 public constant MIN_AMOUNT = 0.1 ether; // \u6700\u4f4e\u5165\u91d1\n\n    address public constant BLACK_ADDRESS = address(0xdEaD);\n    address public constant SELL_MIDDLEWARE = address(0x1);// \u6709\u624b\u7eed\u8d39\n    address public constant BUY_MIDDLEWARE = address(0x2); // \u4e70\u5165\u4e0d\u80fd\u8f6c\u5165address(this), \u65e0\u624b\u7eed\u8d39\n    address public immutable bnbTokenAddress;\n    address public immutable MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nlibrary SafeMath {\n    function add(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 c = a + b;\n        require(c >= a, \"SafeMath: addition overflow\");\n\n        return c;\n    }\n\n    function sub(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        return sub(a, b, \"SafeMath: subtraction overflow\");\n    }\n\n    function sub(\n        uint256 a,\n        uint256 b,\n        string memory errorMessage\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        require(b <= a, errorMessage);\n        uint256 c = a - b;\n\n        return c;\n    }\n\n    function mul(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        if (a == 0) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n\n        uint256 c = a * b;\n        require(c / a == b, \"SafeMath: multiplication overflow\");\n\n        return c;\n    }\n\n    function div(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        return div(a, b, \"SafeMath: division by zero\");\n    }\n\n    function div(\n        uint256 a,\n        uint256 b,\n        string memory errorMessage\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        require(b > 0, errorMessage);\n        uint256 c = a / b;\n\n        return c;\n    }\n\n    function mod(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        return mod(a, b, \"SafeMath: modulo by zero\");\n    }\n\n    function mod(\n        uint256 a,\n        uint256 b,\n        string memory errorMessage\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        require(b != 0, errorMessage);\n        return a % b;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x8c39696d418e695c6ba77e2981c9d33980c6ad21d9334d878ffe7d8ec452e88a","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `spender`s `allowance`. Used in transfers.

params.allowance: Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256.details: Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.balance: Current balance for the interacting account.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC20InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSpender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

FailedCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().details: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).details: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupply().details: Returns the value of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.
